reviews.review_msg: Has real world experience and knows his material well.  Don't expect real world projects to be so giving.  The assignment details were somewhat unclear but he is willing to clarify if you seek information by asking questions.

grammar mistakes in his lecture course materials. ambiguous requirements for quizzes and exams. TA not helpful at all. group assignment class average very high. don't need textbook. open book final, marks are low. he doesn't reply emails. don't remember what i learned in class other than drawing diagrams

Probably the most useless professor I've ever had.  I'm not really sure how he's gotten any positive comments at all.  His assignments are fraught with spelling and grammar errors.  His tests are graded on whether you can guess the exact wording of a phrase he has in mind.  He doesn't teach the material, instead just rambles.  Overall, an F-.

Nice lecture, and is not a terribly boring speaker.  Grading is huge minus though.  The course material is very easy, but freaky marking means you get a mediocre grade no matter how hard you try.  Assignment directions are very vague and unhelpful.  Exam grading is rigid and oftimes illogical.

Lectures are very boring -- the course content is extremely easy, basically an extension of 275 without programming, however, the grading is scaled unfavorable to make the course seem harder than it is, it was a no brainer but somehow ended up with B- ???

It's "real world experience in a course" at it's best. High emphasis on design modeling, with most of it already being familiar at this level of education. He's clear and knows what he is talking about. 1st midterm based solely on notes and 2nd and final on models. Funny guy at times.

Prof has lots of real-world experience and teaches some practical things. You could get through the course without the textbook, save yourself some money. 1st midterm touched on it but was mostly from the notes. 2nd midterm and final you don't need the textbook.  Therefore, attending lecture is very important to learn how to make the diagrams.
it's not a hard course, but lecture is boring.

Great prof. who definitely knows his stuff. Notes are clear and detail enough that he can write a textbook based on it. Quizes, no midterms, are straightforward and easy to do (if you know your stuff). Projects are all case studies, and mostly on models/diagrams. Brings alot of experience and is a funny guy at times.
Good Prof, Knows his stuff very well. Could make classes a little bit more fun, but not bad overall.
Teaching is fairly thorough.  But, he is very arrogant and cocky.
The best cmpt I've ever had.  Humorous. Strong industry experience.
